page.title: 05WILLIAM WATTS
page.content: This is the biography of William Watts the local conservationist.Mr Watts started maintaining the village 20 years ago.He took over from Mr Eric Hawtree.Mr Watts became interested after being asked to help,although he doesn't have anybody to help him.The Parish Council orders the plants and stakes and decides where Mr.Watts is going to put them.In Spring he clears the grass,nettles and weeds,in the Autumn he plants trees and orders stock.In Winter he plants and prunes.Mr Watts finds older people sympathetic to his work,but some youngsters are vandals which he thinks is the village's greatest threat.Mr. Watts saved a 3 acre site which he is developing as a natural habitat planted with native trees.It is called Watts Wood.
